list_definition.definition: to order (a person etc) to return

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He had been recalled to his former post.
I don’t recall when I last saw him.
the recall of soldiers to duty.

list_definition.definition: ˈriːkoːl the ability to remember and repeat what one has seen, heard etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has total recall of the incident.

list_ex_of_english: How the event is defined will determine how it is stored, organized, and recalled at a later date.
On the other hand their smooth, rounded external form may evoke meaning by recalling, perhaps, human crania.
The second memory task was a serial memory task in which patterns of lights were recalled.
Neither public memor ials nor eloquent public speeches recalling the heroism of the dead could fill the void.
Another wife, who recalled long-term marital conflict, had readily accepted formal help.
To this end, he recalled in a newspaper interview two strategies he employed for representing the pidgin dialogue.
He affectionately recalled using books in their bedtime devotions.
Finally, it is worth recalling a slightly earlier study.
